results.content: Excellent course! Various AJAX request method demonstrated. I found great value in being introduced to the whole process of adding, editing and deleting records from a database. This is ready to be applied to other similar projects. I think also if was very good idea to complement AJAX with explanations for the required PHP and mySQL queries, so for front end developers the course provides broader understanding and additional knowledge.
results.content_html: Excellent course! Various AJAX request method demonstrated. I found great value in being introduced to the whole process of adding, editing and deleting records from a database. This is ready to be applied to other similar projects. I think also if was very good idea to complement AJAX with explanations for the required PHP and mySQL queries, so for front end developers the course provides broader understanding and additional knowledge.

results.content:
This is a great starter course for AJAX, assuming you already have a pretty solid understanding of PHP/MySQL.

The examples work well, and I have a much better idea of how to pass data to my API and do stuff with the results I get back.

My only suggestion would be to dive into the "why" a little more on certain things.  Even if they're just brief explanations of what jquery or ajax is doing when you use a particular method.  An example would be the difference between $.ajax and $.post, why one is better than the other for certain situations.
results.content_html:
This is a great starter course for AJAX, assuming you already have a pretty solid understanding of PHP/MySQL.

The examples work well, and I have a much better idea of how to pass data to my API and do stuff with the results I get back.

My only suggestion would be to dive into the "why" a little more on certain things. Even if they're just brief explanations of what jquery or ajax is doing when you use a particular method. An example would be the difference between $.ajax and $.post, why one is better than the other for certain situations.

results.content:
I am giving this course a 5 star rating for 2 reasons:

1 - I never struggled to understand one second of the videos.
2 - The pace of the course is exactly the pace at which life moves, we don't have time for 20+ minute videos. So great work.

Thanks for everything in this course. I did not know any PHP before this, was my first time seeing PHP. But now I feel like I only want to start working on PHP.

Keep it up :].

results.content: Edwin is the best instructor I have ever found on Udemy.  His courses are informative and enjoyable.  I thought there was an issue with this course but it turns out it was my own fault for not remembering to turn on my local server.  The app works exactly as it should because Edwin Diaz knows his stuff and how to teach it.  I also love that he takes into account the length of the videos, making it easier to focus on each task and quickly review when necessary.

Dear brothers and sisters you should try this course if u really want to step up into an application that handles database. It will give u better start.

results.content:
This is the fourth course I took from Edwin.  As always, his lectures are short and to the point (on topic).  Quite easy to follow, with good code-along examples to get students started on their journey.  Great introductory course to using AJAX for dynamic content.  It is helpful, in my humble opinion, to know some basic PHP, HTML, Bootstrap and jQuery/JavaScript to make this a relatively easy experience and to see how all the "pieces" fit together to make dynamic web applications work.

Great job Edwin! You did it again, as with your other introductory courses (see above).

Jack
results.content_html:
This is the fourth course I took from Edwin. As always, his lectures are short and to the point (on topic). Quite easy to follow, with good code-along examples to get students started on their journey. Great introductory course to using AJAX for dynamic content. It is helpful, in my humble opinion, to know some basic PHP, HTML, Bootstrap and jQuery/JavaScript to make this a relatively easy experience and to see how all the "pieces" fit together to make dynamic web applications work.

Great job Edwin! You did it again, as with your other introductory courses (see above).

Jack

results.content: This was a great course, easy to follow and the instructor was clear on the goals for the application and why he was going through different processes. Edwin is great: real, honest, and fun.  I would have liked a little more in-depth explanation of the ajax functions, as I feel that even after completing this course, my understanding of ajax functions (how to use them, which ones to use) is superficial - but I will certainly need to keep practicing and learning!
results.content_html: This was a great course, easy to follow and the instructor was clear on the goals for the application and why he was going through different processes. results.content: First I would like to say that I can't thank the instructor enough. I have almost all of his courses and enjoy his teaching style. I would also like to recommend this course to anyone who is curious to know how AJAX works. The reason I gave this course five stars is because the instructor takes his time in showing the material and is always adding content to the courses which make the course worth so much more. The instructor is also responsive when asked questions and has developed an impressive community of students that are always willing to assist should  you get stuck on a problem.  Again thank you for all your help in furthering my education.

results.content: Yep this course did help me a lot to practice. The material is good for starters like me and it will help you to become a better web developer.  He explains a lot and after that you will be given the possibility to code it yourself. Also he has a positive spirit, which helps you to stay focused. The lectures are not too long, but short and sweet. I hope he will do in the future an advanced PHP & MySQL course with a practical app(OOP company website), JS  and AngularJS with practical Apps. Perhaps he can make more tutorials with technologies which you can use for your own project. Because we need more theory combined with practical things, so we can sharpen our skills.  Edwin Diaz really gives you a complete toolbox to perform well!

results.content: I liked the personality and the voice of the teacher. I knew a lot about PHP and JavaScript before, which helped me to follow the topic with Ajax and Jquery. But if you are a beginner, I find the jumping around and not finisching the  lectures confusing. I had to write my code sometimes to fix things, which is something that shouldn't happen in a course that is open to all levels. Maybe you just give a brief overview on what you are going to do in the next topic and then do that, and not not write some code, erase it, move it and just say i like it better-Explain why and what for. It is part of every programming project to structure yourself and document everything. By writing my own code and look for my mistakes I still learned a lot thou. God bless you.
results.content_html: I liked the personality and the voice of the teacher. I knew a lot about PHP and JavaScript before, which helped me to follow the topic with Ajax and Jquery. I had to write my code sometimes to fix things, which is something that shouldn't happen in a course that is open to all levels. Maybe you just give a brief overview on what you are going to do in the next topic and then do that, and not not write some code, erase it, move it and just say i like it better-Explain why and what for. It is part of every programming project to structure yourself and document everything. By writing my own code and look for my mistakes I still learned a lot thou. God bless you.

results.content:
This is not the first course I have taken with Edwin Diaz, and I am currently working on others as well, including his comprehensive PHP for Beginners course, which I am moving towards completing at the moment.

Edwin is simply the most compassionate and engaging instructor I have ever worked with on Udemy.com. He clearly cares about his students, and goes way beyond the call of duty to make certain that his students learn and gain confidence in their abilities.

Moreover, his lectures are fun, never boring and lessen the growing pains of learning. For this, I am sincerely grateful and offer my heartfelt thanks to him.

Edwin goes a little fast sometimes, so I just slow down the speed of the video.  Always 5 stars because he puts an extensive amount of work that shows he is very invested in doing the best he can.  Thank you!

I noticed the delete error in the end lectures, and before I even had a chance to inquire Edwin had it all covered.  It really impresses me how he allows himself to make mistakes and share the solutions.  If you were to simply edit and correct then we wouldn't know how to troubleshoot.  Very much appreciated!!

results.content:
Good course overall. Provides nice coverage of AJAX, plus a simple application that you can build on and use in other application development.
My only criticism would be that the code is a bit messy; I'd much prefer if the code indentation and line spacing was consistent - which is much needed in professional programming. Other than that nice course, worth the money and Edwin is especially wonderful to listen to with the enthusiasm he brings to the lectures.
results.content_html:

Other than that nice course, worth the money and Edwin is especially wonderful to listen to with the enthusiasm he brings to the lectures.

results.content: Great class man! wow! just really exciting to learn something so powerful. I will have to send you a can of "Bustello Cafe" "Porque, si es bueno, tiene que sel Goya" ha ha ha!!! so that you can keep on truckin with these tutorials. I just don't know where to send it hehehee!!!! Thanks man! Although I forgot to mention that on my end, whenever I ran a query or added a car to the data base it wouldn't work at all. The reason why was because there were errors on the exercise files which were not corrected. For example on the add_cars.php right after the INSERT INTO cars...etc.. on the next line you wrote: $update_car_name instead of $query_car_name. I looked at this closely and figured that this is what the problem must have been and so it was. Everything works well now. Thanks Man!! I'm not tryna be an ass just tryna be a pro like you.
results.content_html: Great class man! wow! just really exciting to learn something so powerful. I will have to send you a can of "Bustello Cafe" "Porque, si es bueno, tiene que sel Goya" ha ha ha!!! so that you can keep on truckin with these tutorials. I just don't know where to send it hehehee!!!! Thanks man! Although I forgot to mention that on my end, whenever I ran a query or added a car to the data base it wouldn't work at all. The reason why was because there were errors on the exercise files which were not corrected. For example on the add_cars.php right after the INSERT INTO cars...etc.. on the next line you wrote: $update_car_name instead of $query_car_name. I looked at this closely and figured that this is what the problem must have been and so it was. Everything works well now. Thanks Man!! I'm not tryna be an ass just tryna be a pro like you.

results.content: Another great course from Edwin, I have been nervous of this one as I do not get on well with Javascript! however, this was delivered in such a way that I understood exactly what was being shown, a simple application that clearly showed the full CRUD interacting with the database from Javascript/JQuery using AJAX, well done Edwin.

I am so happy that I am able to learn this code languages from Edwin. Edwin is such a good instructor, his lectures are very informative and always up to date. Also the way he is teaching is amazing. Very clear instructions!

Your Student,
Kevin.

results.content: Excellent course. Edwin does a great job showing you the capabilities of AJAX. Having that real-time update without a refresh can look awesome on many of your own projects. If you want to learn AJAX and how to go about using it with PHP and MYSQL, then look no further!
